gurmukhi: BUK lgI jb hI hir kO qb pY jsuDw Qn kO iqn cwihXoM ] mwq auTI n BXo mn kRu`D qbY pg so mih gofkY bwihXo ]
transliteration: Bhookh Lagijah Hihar(i) Kau Tab Pai Jasudhaa Than Kau Tin Chaahiyau|| Maat Outhina Bhayo Man Kruddh Tabai Pag So Maih Godkai Baahiyo||
translation: When Krishna became hungry, he wanted to drink his mother Yashoda’s milk; he moved his foot with force, the mother got up without getting angry;

gurmukhi: qyl DrXo Ar iGau BrXo Cut BUim prXo jsu sXwm srwihXo ] hoq kulwhl miD purI DrnI ko mno sB Sok su lwihXo ]104]
transliteration: Tel Ddaryo Ar Gheeo Bdaryo Chhout Bhoom(i) Daryo Jas(u) Syam Saraahyo|| Hot Kulaahal Madh(i) Puridharniko Mano Sabh Shok Su Laahiyo||104||
translation: This vessels full of oil and ghee fell down from her hands on the earth; the poet Shyam visualized this scene in his imagination; on the other hand, hearing about the killing of Putna, there was great tumult in Braja country and the suffering of the earth

gurmukhi: Dwie gey biRj lok sBY hir jI iqn Awpny kMT lgwey ] Aaur sBY biRj lok bDU iml Bwqn Bwqn mMgl gwey ]
transliteration: Dhaae Gad Brij Lok Sabhai Har(i) Jitin Aapane Kanth Lagade|| Aur Sabhai Brij Lok Badhoo Mil Bhaatan Bhaatan Mandal Gade||
translation: All the people of Braja came running and everyone of them hugged Krishna; the women of Braja country began to sing songs of joy of various types;

gurmukhi: BUim hnI niB Xo ieh kauqk bwrn Byd XO BwK sunwey ] ckRq bwq Bey suinkY Apny mn mY iqn swc n lwey ]105]
transliteration: Bhoom(i) Halinabh(i) Yo Eh Kaoutak Baaran Bhed You Bhaakh Sounaae|| Chakrat Baat Bhae Soun(i)kai Apne Man Mai Tin Saach Na Laae||105||
translation: The earth shook and the children began to relate various stories about the killing of Putana, hearing which all marveled in their minds and hesitated to accept this true episode.105.

gurmukhi: kwnih ky isr swQ CuhwiekY Aaur sBY iqn AMgn ko ] Aru lok bulwie sBY biRj ky bhu dwn dXo iqn mMgn ko ]
transliteration: Kaanah(i) Ke Sir Saath Chhudaae-kai Aur Sabhai Tin Anad Ko|| Ar(u) Lok Bulaae Sabhai Brij Ke Bahu Daan Dayo Tin Manad Ko||
translation: Inviting all the people of Braja, Nand and Yashod gave good deal of alms by touching them with the head and other limbs of Krishna;

gurmukhi: Ar dwn dXo sB hI giH ko krkY ptrMgn rMgn ko ] ieh swj bnwie dXo iqn kO Aru Aaur dXo duK BMgn ko ]106]
transliteration: Ar Daan Dayo Dabh Higrah(i) Ko Karkai Patranad Ranad Ko|| Eh Saaj Banaae Dayo Tin Kau Ar(u) Dayo Doukh Bhanad Ko||106||
translation: The charity of clothes etc. was given to many beggars; in this way many gifts of charity were presented in order to remove the sufferings of all.106.
Speech of Kansa addressed to Tranavrata:

gurmukhi: jbY pUqnw hnI sunI gokl ibKY ] qiRxwvrq so kihXo jwhu qwko iqKY ] nMd bwl ko mwro AYsy ptk kY ] ho pwQr jwx clweIAY kr so Jtk kY ]107]
transliteration: Jahai Pootanaa Hanisounigokal Bikhai|| Trinaavarat So Kahiyo Jaah(u) Taako Tikhai Nand Baal Ko Mdaro Aise Patak Kai|| Ho Paathar Jaan Chalaaiai Kar So Jhatak Kai||107||
translation: When kansa came to know that Putana had been killed in Gokul, he said to Tranvrata, “You go there and kill the son of Nand by dashing him like a stone with a jerk.107.

gurmukhi: kMsih kY qslIm clXo hY qiRxwvRq SIGR dY gokl AwXo ] baufr ko qb rUp DrXo DrnI pr kY bl paun bhwXo ]
transliteration: Kansah(i) Kai Tasleem Chadyo Hai Tarinaavrata Sheeghra Dai Gokal Aayo|| Baudar Ko Tab Roop Ddaryo Dharnidar Kai Bal Paoun Bahaayo||
translation: Bowing before Kansa, Tranavrata quickly reached Gokul and transformed himself into a duststorm and began to blow with a great speed;

gurmukhi: Awgm jwnkY BwrI BXo hir mwr qbY vh BUim prwXo ] DUr Bey diRg mUMd kY lokn lY hir ko niBky mg DwXo ]108]
transliteration: Oogad Jaan-kai Bhaaribhayo Har(i) Maar Tabai Vah Bhoom(i) Paraayo|| Dhoor Bhoor Bhae Drig Moondd Kai Lokan Lai Har(i) Ko Nabh(i)ke Mag Dhaayo||108||
translation: Krishna became extremely weighty and colliding against him, Tranavrata fell down on the earth, but still when the eyes of the people were filled with dust and closed down, he flew in the sky taking Krishna with him.108.

gurmukhi: jau hir jI niB bIc gXo kr qau Apny bl ko qn c`tw ] rUp BXwnk ko DirkY imil ju`D krXo qb rwCs P`tw ]
transliteration: Jau Har(i) Jinabh(i) Beech Gado Kar Tau Apne Bal Ko Tan Chattaa|| Roop Bhayaanak Ko Dhar(i)kai Mil(i) Jaddh Daryo Tah Raachhas Phattaa||
translation: When he reached high in the sky alongwith Krishna, because of the beating of Krishna his power began to decline; manifesting himself in a dreadful form Krishna fought a battle with that demon and wounded him;
